text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Game Boy is a portable 8-bit handheld console developed by Nintendo in 1989. It was the first in a large line of portable handhelds, succeeding the Game & Watch handhelds developed before it. It was designed by Gunpei Yokoi and Nintendo Research & Development. Featuring a 4MHz processor, 8KB of RAM and a 160x144 dot-matrix display with 4 shades of gray, it was well known for its long battery life lasting around 30 hours on a set of AAs. The original system featured a link cable that could be used to play local multiplayer games with multiple consoles. This can now be emulated via horizontal split-screen.
